summary: A set of lightweight helper modules that define simple functions, stubs, and placeholder entry points used by the test suite to demonstrate and verify modern Python exception handling features—including ExceptionGroup handling, grouped causes and contexts, structural pattern matching, positional‑only parameters, type hints, and the walrus operator—while incorporating basic logging utilities.
business_intent: Enable reliable testing and documentation of contemporary exception handling mechanisms in the codebase, ensuring that new language features are correctly exercised and validated.
